results.name: Cate Shortland
results.biography: Cate Shortland (born 10 August 1968) is an Australian director and screenwriter. She received international acclaim for her 2004 romantic drama film Somersault, her 2012 historical drama film Lore, and her 2017 psychological thriller film Berlin Syndrome. She is best known for directing the 2021 superhero film Black Widow. Source: Wikidata; 01/08/2023

results.name: Frank Scheffer
results.biography:
biography:
Frank Scheffer (1956, Venlo) studied at the Academy for Industrial Design in Eindhoven, at the Dutch Film and Television Academy and attended a course in experimental film given by Frans Zwartjes. His work expresses a fascination with the relationship between music and image. (Rotterdam film festival site)

results.name: Johan Van Der Keuken
results.biography:
1938-2001

Johan Van Der Keuken has made 50 films, many of them political documentaries such as "The Flat Jungle", "The Palestinians" and "I Love Dollars". His last film "The Big Holiday" was made as a response to his diagnosis of cancer.

results.name: Anthony Discenza
results.biography:
Anthony Discenza was born in New Jersey in 1967 and currently resides in Oakland, CA. He received his undergraduate degree in Studio Art at Wesleyan University in 1990 and an MFA at the California College of Arts and Crafts in 2000. In addition to various individual projects, he devotes a great deal of time to HalfLifers, an ongoing collaboration with longtime friend and fellow video artist Torsten Z. Burns. Mr. Discenza's solo and collaborative work has been shown at numerous national and international venues, including The Whitney Museum of American Art, The New York Video Festival, the Pandaemonium Festival, The Pacific Film Archive, The Impakt Festival, The Philadelphia Museum of Art, and the Museum of Modern Art in New York. He was recently included in the 2000 Whitney Biennial.

results.name: Mona Hatoum
results.biography:
Born 1952, Beirut, Lebanon
Lives and works in London.

Mona Hatoum is an artist living in Britain whose work around issues of fear, fascination, and the body takes the form of performance, video, installation, and photography. Hatoum was born in Lebanon and attended Beirut University College. Her graduate education in London was followed by artist-in-residencies at Western Front in Vancouver and broad international exhibitions, including major solo shows at Centre Pompidou in Paris and Arnolfini in Bristol.

Mona Hatoum was born into a Palestinian family in Beirut in 1952 and since 1975 has lived and worked in London. She originally came to England on a visit and stayed on when the outbreak of the civil war in Lebanon prevented her from returning.

After studying at the Byam Shaw and the Slade School of Art, Hatoum first became widely known in the mid 80s for a series of performance and video work that focused with a great intensity on the body. Since the beginning of the 90s her work moved increasingly towards large-scale installation works that aim to engage the viewer in conflicting emotions of desire and revulsion, fear and fascination. Hatoum has developed a language in which familiar, domestic, every day objects like chairs, beds, cots and kitchen utensils are made to appear threatening and strange. Even the human body is rendered unfamiliar in Corps Etranger (1994), a video installation that displays an endoscopic journey through the interior landscape of her own body.

Hatoum's work has been exhibited widely in Europe, the United States and Canada. In 1997 a major survey of her work was organised by the Museum of Contemporary Art, Chicago and toured to the New Museum of Contemporary Art, New York, the Museum of Modern Art, Oxford and the Scottish National Gallery of Modern Art, Edinburgh (1998). Other solo exhibitions include Centre Georges Pompidou, Paris in 1994 and Castello di Rivoli, Turin in 1999. Hatoum's exhibition 'The Entire World as a Foreign Land' was the inaugural exhibition for the launch of Tate Britain, London in 2000.

results.name: Les LeVeque
results.biography:
Les LeVeque is an artist who works with electronic media and lives in New York City. Recently he has been making short videos and video installations where Hollywood movies are transformed into a sensuous hallucinatory unveiling of repressed representations. Screenings of his experimental videos include: The New York Video Festival, Pandemonium Festival of the Moving Image, The Sundance Film Festival, Festival International Nouveau Cinema Nouveaux Medias, Viennale Vienna International Film Festival, the San Francisco International Film Festival, the 2000 Whitney Biennial and the Pompidou Center.
